page.title: 01The Hills around Black Combe
page.content: The area is of rolling hills & tiny rivulets. Dominated by black combe, the highest point. All around are uninterrupted sweeping views. On a sunny day, a noiseless on-top-of-the- world feeling abounds. Underfoot it is a little boggy; long moss affording a surface similar to walking on sponge. The landscape, inhabited solely by Herdwick & Swaledale sheep, is treeless, bushless & heatherless. There are intermittant outcrops of rock as well as single occasional boulders. The only signs of human usage of the land are the ancient dry- stone walls, tumbling down in places; & their more modern, less picturesque & less durable replacements of rusting single-wire fencing altogether a peaceful, wild & romantic area.
